properties.address: 35 West Princes Street, Helensburgh, Argyll & Bute G84 8TF
properties.description: While we cater primarily for the elderly all are welcome We have been open for visitors during Advent. We will update when we know when we will be able to open in the New Year.
properties.title: Helensburgh United Reformed Church

properties.description: Blairmore Village Hall hosts a weekly "Drop in" on a Thursday morning. Called the Shore Hub, it is a warm and welcoming space for folk to go in for as long as they wish to. There is no charge, and if demand were sufficient, they could extend it to include a soup-and-sandwich lunch. Contact for information is Agnes Harvey, 07802 424487.- or just pop along to Blairmore from 11.00 on a Thursday.
properties.title: Blairmore Village Hall

properties.description: Grey Matters Active Ageing are keeping the older community in Helensburgh and Lomond warm this winter. They have two ‘Hot Spot’ coffee mornings a week () offering warm drinks and even warmer company. They also have 10 other interest groups to tap into during the week and are adding to them all the time including more evening and weekend activities too. They have organised outings and several festive celebrations for the coming months so there’s plenty to look forward to during bleak times. If anyone is interested in joining, they can pop into the Active Ageing Centre and find out how to get involved!
properties.title: Grey Matters Active Ageing

properties.description: The community library in Cove Burgh Hall is open as a warm space on: Monday 2-5pm Friday 10-1pm Saturday 10-1pm

hours._text: The community library in Cove Burgh Hall is open as a warm space on: Monday 2-5pm Friday 10-1pm Saturday 10-1pm
